intro: Dolianthus clemensiae, commonly known as the Clemens' dianthus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many showy, colorful flowers. The plant features upright stems with clustered, pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery fuzz, giving it a distinctive appearance. Dolianthus clemensiae is adapted to cool, dry climates and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
